messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the v8 program, here is the asan report

This is an V8 error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

V8 is running with experimental features enabled. Stability and security will suffer.


#
# Fatal error in ../../src/wasm/wasm-js.cc, line 664
# Debug check failed: i_isolate()->has_exception() || thrower_.error() implies callback_info_.GetReturnValue().Get()->IsUndefined().
#
#
#
#FailureMessage Object: 0x79c498737460
==== C stack trace ===============================

/testcases/v8-regress-372993873/exp.sh: line 6: 86004 Trace/breakpoint trap   out/debug_asan/d8 --harmony-struct --allow-natives-syntax "$1"


The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'src/wasm/wasm-js.cc', 'start_line': 660, 'end_line': 670}`
responded: I'll analyze the sanitizer report and patch the identified issue. Let me start by examining the error location and understanding the problem.

 42| namespace v8 {
 43| 
 44| using i::wasm::CompileTimeImport;
 45| using i::wasm::CompileTimeImports;
 46| using i::wasm::ErrorThrower;
 47| using i::wasm::IndexType;
 48| using i::wasm::WasmEnabledFeatures;
 49| 
 50| namespace internal {
 51| 
 52| // Note: The implementation of this function is in runtime-wasm.cc, in order
 53| // to be able to use helpers that aren't visible outside that file.
 54| void ToUtf8Lossy(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> string, std::string& out);
 55| 
 56| }  // namespace internal
 57| 
 58| class WasmStreaming::WasmStreamingImpl {
 59|  public:
 60|   WasmStreamingImpl(
 61|       i::Isolate* isolate, const char* api_method_name,
 62|       CompileTimeImports compile_imports,
 63|       std::shared_ptr<internal::wasm::CompilationResultResolver> resolver)
 64|       : i_isolate_(isolate),
 65|         enabled_features_(WasmEnabledFeatures::FromIsolate(i_isolate_)),
 66|         streaming_decoder_(i::wasm::GetWasmEngine()->StartStreamingCompilation(
 67|             i_isolate_, enabled_features_, std::move(compile_imports),
 68|             handle(i_isolate_->context(), i_isolate_), api_method_name,
 69|             resolver)),
 70|         resolver_(std::move(resolver)) {}
 71| 
 72|   void OnBytesReceived(const uint8_t* bytes, size_t size) {
 73|     streaming_decoder_->OnBytesReceived(base::VectorOf(bytes, size));
 74|   }
 75|   void Finish(bool can_use_compiled_module) {
 76|     streaming_decoder_->Finish(can_use_compiled_module);
 77|   }
 78| 
 79|   void Abort(MaybeLocal<Value> exception) {
 80|     i::HandleScope scope(i_isolate_);
 81|     streaming_decoder_->Abort();
 82| 
 83|     // If no exception value is provided, we do not reject the promise. This can
 84|     // happen when streaming compilation gets aborted when no script execution
 85|     // is allowed anymore, e.g. when a browser tab gets refreshed.
 86|     if (exception.IsEmpty()) return;
 87| 
 88|     resolver_->OnCompilationFailed(
 89|         Utils::OpenHandle(*exception.ToLocalChecked()));
 90|   }
 91| 
 92|   bool SetCompiledModuleBytes(base::Vector<const uint8_t> bytes) {
 93|     if (!i::wasm::IsSupportedVersion(bytes, enabled_features_)) return false;
 94|     streaming_decoder_->SetCompiledModuleBytes(bytes);
 95|     return true;
 96|   }
 97| 
 98|   void SetMoreFunctionsCanBeSerializedCallback(
 99|       std::function<void(CompiledWasmModule)> callback) {
100|     streaming_decoder_->SetMoreFunctionsCanBeSerializedCallback(
